en: So talking about with like athletes, how did the Advanced Conceptss
team work with athletes to help for the new product?
Yeah.
Being being athletes ourselves is has been something
that Advanced Concepts has always kind of lived by.
So a number of the team members that we have actually are our athletes
or are doing things in the mountains alongside our athletes.
So it's a really iterative process, and we're really close
with professional athletes as well as, professional mountain guides,
search and rescue.
We have someone on our team who is on the search and rescue in Squamish.
So there's the we have a very close relationship with the athletes.
And when we build a new product, we want to make sure
we're out in the mountain.
So we're either,
you know, skinning behind an athlete or we're,
you know, one of our team members is climbing with them.
Because we have the research side of our team as well.
We actually, we we do some testing in-house.
You might have seen some of it.
But we also bring that research out into the mountains.
So we want to do test, you know, a new harness or test a new product.
We're doing that in the mountains.
We're collecting feedback live.
So we have a very, very close relationship with our athletes
to make sure that we're always solving a real problem.
For them, at the very point of extreme need.
Okay.
So, yeah.
So how many people are working with you on your team?
Our team, we have we have,
I would say 25 to 30.
And the range is because we have some contractors,
we actually have some athletes that, are professional
athletes at Arc'teryx that also have, like an engineering background.
And so we actually work with them when they're not competing.
And they work on some projects with us as well. So,
there's, there's a little bit of a range.
So we have research,
engineering, design and then material, advanced materials.
And so those, those functions work together on a project
so that all three of those are perfect.
Yeah.
So, yeah, 25 to 30, depending if we want to stay small.
Because for us it's about working on the right projects,
and making sure we can truly have a disruptive concept.
